bug.author: arueckle
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>Information</denchmark-h>
Model I am using (Bert, XLNet ...): bert-base-uncased Language I am using the model on (English, Chinese ...): EN Adapter setup I am using (if any): The problem arises when using:
the official example scripts: (give details below) my own modified scripts: (give details below)
The tasks I am working on is:
an official GLUE/SQUaD task: (give the name) my own task or dataset: (give details below)
<denchmark-h:h2>To reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
self.bert.load_adapter("sts/qqp@ukp", "text_task", config=PfeifferConfig()) self.bert.load_adapter("nli/rte@ukp", "text_task", config=PfeifferConfig()) self.bert.load_adapter("nli/qnli@ukp", "text_task", config=PfeifferConfig()) self.bert.load_adapter("nli/multinli@ukp", "text_task", config=PfeifferConfig()) self.bert.load_adapter("lingaccept/cola@ukp", "text_task", config=PfeifferConfig())
AdapterFusion version of QQP works. Does not work for cola and multinli. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Can load adapters.

comments.comment: the adapters are loaded however the parameters still contain weights which are no longer required: *adapter_attention.*. The file thus needs to be updated by deleting these parameters such that this log is no longer printed
True, it works. Just ignore the warning
